title: ARCHIVED: Mpox Vaccinations Given to SF Residents by Demographics
description:
In early February 2024, we will be retiring the Mpox Vaccinations Given to SF Residents by Demographics dataset. This dataset will be archived and no longer update. A historic record of this data will remain available. A. SUMMARY This dataset represents doses of mpox vaccine (JYNNEOS) administered in California to residents of San Francisco ages 18 years or older. This dataset only includes doses of the JYNNEOS vaccine given on or after 5/1/2022. All vaccines given to people who live in San Francisco are included, no matter where the vaccination took place. The data are broken down by multiple demographic stratifications. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED Information on doses administered to those who live in San Francisco is from the California Immunization Registry (CAIR2), run by the California Department of Public Health (CDPH). Information on individuals’ city of residence, age, race, ethnicity, and sex are recorded in CAIR2 and are self-reported at the time of vaccine administration. Because CAIR2 does not include information on sexual orientation, we pull information from the San Francisco Department of Public Health’s Epic Electronic Health Record (EHR). The populations represented in our Epic data and the CAIR2 data are different. Epic data only include vaccinations administered at SFDPH managed sites to SF residents. Data notes for population characteristic types are listed below. Age * Data only include individuals who are 18 years of age or older. Race/ethnicity * The response option "Other Race" is categorized by the data source system, and the response option "Unknown" refers to a lack of data. Sex * The response option "Other" is categorized by the source system, and the response option "Unknown" refers to a lack of data. Sexual orientation * The response option “Unknown/Declined” refers to a lack of data or individuals who reported multiple different sexual orientations during their most recent interaction with SFDPH. For convenience, we provide the 2020 5-year American Community Survey population estimates. C. UPDATE PROCESS Updated daily via automated process. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET This dataset includes many different types of demographic groups. Filter the “demographic_group” column to explore a topic area. Then, the “demographic_subgroup” column shows each group or category within that topic area and the total count of doses administered to that population subgroup. E. CHANGE LOG
  • UPDATE 1/3/2023: Due to low case numbers, this page will no longer include vaccinations after 12/31/2022.

columns.name: data_source
columns.description: This field indicates whether data are coming from CAIR2, operated by the California Department of Public Health (CDPH), or being collected by the San Francisco Department of Public Health (SFDPH) in Epic. CAIR2 does not collect sexual orientation for vaccination so we use SFDPH data from Epic instead. This column is listed as “[data system] ([governing agency])”, e.g. CAIR2 (CDPH) or Epic (SFDPH).

columns.name: demographic_group
columns.description: Type of demographic group included (e.g. Age, Race/Ethnicity)

columns.name: demographic_subgroup
columns.description: Specific demographic group counted in a given record (e.g. 18-24, Asian)

columns.name: total_recipients
columns.description: Count of SF residents in each demographic_subgroup who have received at least one JYNNEOS dose

columns.name: percent_of_recipients
columns.description: Percent of JYNNEOS recipients in each demographic_subgroup across all SF JYNNEOS recipients

columns.name: population_estimate
columns.description: 2020 5-year American Community Survey population estimates for given demographic_subgroup

columns.name: max_date_administered
columns.description: Data includes vaccine doses administered through this date

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was last updated in the source system

columns.name: data_updated_at
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was last compiled by scripts

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was last updated here (in the open data portal)
